DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to a patient previously recieved anticancer drugs that kill cells to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient previously recieved anticancer drugs that kill cells to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Cytotoxic Chemotherapy Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Anticancer drugs that kill cells, especially cancer cells.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A drug therapy that is used to destroy cancer cells.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received any prio
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for ALCL or any previously diagnosed cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have any other cytotoxic chemotherapy prior to beginning protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive standard cytotoxic maintenance chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment or IT methotrexate, has patient received any other prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL or any cancer diagnosed prior to the initiation of protocol therapy on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment or administration of intrathecal methotrexate per protocol dosing, has patient received any other prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL or any cancer diagnosed prior to the initiation of protocol therapy on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment or the administration of intrathecal methotrexate or intrathecal cytarabine, has patient received any other prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of ALL or any cancer diagnosed prior to the initiation of protocol therapy on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment, IT methotrexate, or IT cytarabine administration, has patient received any other prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL or any cancer diagnosed prior to the initiation of protocol therapy on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient receiving intrathecal cytarabine, methotrexate, and/or hydrocortisone?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving intrathecal cytarabine, methotrexate, and/or hydrocortisone?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment or intrathecal cytarabine, has patient received any prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL, MPAL, or B-LLy or for any cancer diagnosed prior to initiation of protocol therapy on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment or the administration of intrathecal cytarabine, has patient received any prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL or B-LLy or for any cancer diagnosed prior to initiation of protocol therapy on AALL1731?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment or intrathecal cytarabine, has patient received any prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL, MPAL, or B-LLy or for any cancer diagnosed prior to initiation of protocol therapy on this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive IT Cytarabine prior to or at the start of the current cycle?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Be currently receiving any cytotoxic chemotherapy (can be cytotoxic chemotherapy alone or in combination with biologics and/or antibodies)
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be currently receiving any cytotoxic chemotherapy (can be cytotoxic chemotherapy alone or in combination with biologics and/or antibodies)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received less than or equal to 1 line of cytotoxic therapy in the platinum-resistant setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any Cytotoxic chemotherapy within the last 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received more than 2 lines of cytotoxic therapy in the platinum-resistant setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: With the exception of steroid pretreatment and steroid cytoreduction or intrathecal cytarabine, has patient received any prior cytotoxic chemotherapy for either the current diagnosis of B-ALL, MPAL, or B-LLy or for any cancer diagnosed prior to initiation of protocol therapy on this study
